original: skyon 'dogs par byed pa'i tshig nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyon 'dogs par byed pa'i tshig nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the words that are to be faulted, the following is said:

original: spyi'i don gang yin /
analyzed: spyi'i don gang yin /
translated: What is the general meaning of the reason?

original: bya ba dang ldan pas bya ba gzhan mi byed dam /
analyzed: bya ba dang ldan pas bya ba gzhan mi byed dam /
translated: Does one who possesses an action not perform any other action?🔽Or does one not perform that action with which one is endowed?

original: 'on te bya ba gang dang ldan pa de mi byed pa yin zhes brtag pa gnyis dri ba smras te /
analyzed: 'on te bya ba gang dang ldan pa de mi byed pa yin zhes brtag pa gnyis dri ba smras te /
translated: The two investigations are stated as questions.

original: khyed dbu ma pa na re /
analyzed: khyed dbu ma pa na re /
translated: You Followers of the Middle Way say,

original: don dam par 'gro ba po mi 'gro ste bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba dang / de bzhin du don dam par 'gro ba po sdod par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: don dam par 'gro ba po mi 'gro ste bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba dang / de bzhin du don dam par 'gro ba po sdod par mi 'thad de /
translated: “Ultimately, the goer does not go because he is endowed with the action of going,” and, “Ultimately, it is untenable for the goer to rest because he is endowed with the action of going.”

original: 'gro ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs bya ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba de'i spyi'i don gang yin /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs bya ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba de'i spyi'i don gang yin /
translated: What is the general meaning of the reason you use, “because he is endowed with the action”?

original: ci bya ba dang ldan pas bya ba gzhan thams cad mi byed pa yin nam /🔽'on te bya ba gang dang ldan pa de nyid yin zhes brtag pa gnyis dris pa yin no //
analyzed: ci bya ba dang ldan pas bya ba gzhan thams cad mi byed pa yin nam /🔽'on te bya ba gang dang ldan pa de nyid yin zhes brtag pa gnyis dris pa yin no //
translated: Does one who possesses an action not perform any other action?🔽Or does one not perform that action with which one is endowed?

original: de la gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na ni dpe med de de las gzhan pa'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gal te bya ba dang ldan pas bya ba gzhan mi byed par 'dod na ni des na khyed dbu ma pa'i
analyzed: de la gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na ni dpe med de de las gzhan pa'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gal te bya ba dang ldan pas bya ba gzhan mi byed par 'dod na ni des na khyed dbu ma pa'i
translated: If you assert the former, then there is no example because it is the performance of another action.

original: dpe sdod pa po bzhin te zhes bya ba dang / lhas byin 'gro ba ma nyams pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de mi rung ste /
analyzed: dpe sdod pa po bzhin te zhes bya ba dang / lhas byin 'gro ba ma nyams pa bzhin no zhes bya ba de mi rung ste /
translated: If you assert that one who possesses action does not perform another action, then your example, “Like one who is sitting,” and “Like Devadatta who is not impaired while walking,” are not suitable.

original: sdod pa po yang 'gro ba las gzhan pa sdod pa'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir dang / lhas byin 'gro ba ma nyams pa yang sdod pa gzhan pa 'gro ba'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir bya ba dang ldan pas bya ba gzhan mi byed pa nyid ces bya ba de mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sdod pa po yang 'gro ba las gzhan pa sdod pa'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir dang / lhas byin 'gro ba ma nyams pa yang sdod pa gzhan pa 'gro ba'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir bya ba dang ldan pas bya ba gzhan mi byed pa nyid ces bya ba de mi rung ngo //
translated: Because one who is sitting performs the action of sitting, which is different from walking, and Devadatta who is not impaired while walking performs the action of walking, which is different from sitting, it is not suitable to say “One who possesses action does not perform another action.”

original: 'on te @273b brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na ni /
analyzed: 'on te @273b brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na ni /
translated: But if you assert the latter,🔽then it follows that the subject, Devadatta, does not perform the action of walking because of being Devadatta.

original: de lta na yang don 'gal ba nyid yin te zhes bya ba ni 'on te bya ba gang dang ldan pa de ni mi byed par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang don 'gal ba nyid yin te zhes bya ba ni 'on te bya ba gang dang ldan pa de ni mi byed par 'dod na ni /
translated: If you assert that one who possesses an action does not perform it,

original: de lta na yang khyed dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don mngon sum dang 'gal ba dang / 'jig rten dang 'gal ba nyid yin pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta na yang khyed dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don mngon sum dang 'gal ba dang / 'jig rten dang 'gal ba nyid yin pas mi rung ngo //
translated: then even so, your Madhyamaka reason, “because it possesses an action,” is unsuitable because it contradicts direct perception and it contradicts the world.

original: ji ltar mngon sum dang 'gal ba nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon sum dang 'gal ba nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How does it contradict direct perception?

original: de'i phyir smra ba po tshig smra bar byed cing gcod pa po shing gcod par byed pa dang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir smra ba po tshig smra bar byed cing gcod pa po shing gcod par byed pa dang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: To respond, he says, “The speaker speaks, the cutter cuts,” and so on.

original: smra ba po smra ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa yang smra ba'i bya ba de byed par mngon sum du snang la /
analyzed: smra ba po smra ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa yang smra ba'i bya ba de byed par mngon sum du snang la /
translated: The speaker who possesses the action of speaking is directly perceived to perform that action of speaking.

original: gcod pa po gcad pa'i bya ba dang ldan pa yang shing gcad pa'i bya ba de byed par mngon sum du snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gcod pa po gcad pa'i bya ba dang ldan pa yang shing gcad pa'i bya ba de byed par mngon sum du snang ba'i phyir /
translated: The cutter who possesses the action of cutting is directly perceived to perform that action of cutting.

original: bya ba gang dang ldan pa de mi byed par 'dod pa ni mngon sum dang 'gal ba nyid yin pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: bya ba gang dang ldan pa de mi byed par 'dod pa ni mngon sum dang 'gal ba nyid yin pas mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable to assert that one who possesses an action does not perform that action, because that contradicts direct perception.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten dang 'gal ba nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten dang 'gal ba nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How does it contradict the world?

original: de'i phyir de dang ldan pa nyid kyis de byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dang ldan pa nyid kyis de byed pa'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore he says, “because one performs that action by virtue of possessing it.”

original: bya ba de dang ldan pa nyid kyis bya ba de byed par 'jig rten la grags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba de dang ldan pa nyid kyis bya ba de byed par 'jig rten la grags pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is well known in the world that one performs an action by virtue of possessing that action.

original: bya ba gang dang ldan pa de mi byed par 'dod pas ni 'jig rten dang 'gal ba nyid kyang yin pas de mi rung ngo zhes zer ba yin no //
analyzed: bya ba gang dang ldan pa de mi byed par 'dod pas ni 'jig rten dang 'gal ba nyid kyang yin pas de mi rung ngo zhes zer ba yin no //
translated: Therefore he says, “because it contradicts the world to assert that one who possesses an action does not perform that action.”

original: de skad ces zer ba nyid kyis de byed 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba nyid kyis de byed 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: The Commentary itself explains this:

original: re zhig de la gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na ni dpe med de /
analyzed: re zhig de la gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na ni dpe med de /
translated: “If you assert the first option, there is no example.

original: de las gzhan pa'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba de'i lan du /
translated: Because it performs an action other than that.”

original: de la 'dir dpe med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dir dpe med pa ma yin te /
translated: In response to that, he says, “In this regard, there is no absence of an example.”

original: de las gzhan pa'i bya ba byed pa po nyid du ma grub pa sdod pa po la sogs pa dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ji skad bshad pa'i skyon 'dogs pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i bya ba byed pa po nyid du ma grub pa sdod pa po la sogs pa dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ji skad bshad pa'i skyon 'dogs pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: But the other, the nongoer, is not established as an agent of another action, such as sitting.

original: 'gro ba smra ba dag na re /
analyzed: 'gro ba smra ba dag na re /
translated: The proponents of going say,

original: de la gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na ni dpe med de /
analyzed: de la gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na ni dpe med de /
translated: “If you assert it in the first way, there is no example.

original: de las gzhan pa'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Because it is an agent of another action.”

original: ded dbu ma pas bya ba dang ldan pas bya ba gzhan mi byed par 'dod pa de la 'dir dpe med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ded dbu ma pas bya ba dang ldan pas bya ba gzhan mi byed par 'dod pa de la 'dir dpe med pa ma yin te /
translated: The Followers of the Middle Way do not accept that an agent of going is an agent of another action.🔽The nongoer, which is not established as an agent of going, is not accepted as an example of the goer going.🔽The nongoer is not established as an agent of going.

original: 'gro ba'i bya ba de las gzhan pa'i byed pa po 'gro ba'i byed pa po nyid du ma grub pa sdod pa dang nyal ba la sogs pa'i byed pa po dang 'dug pa po dang nyal ba po la sogs pa 'gro ba po 'gro ba'i dpe nyid du🔽mi @274a * //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bya ba de las gzhan pa'i byed pa po 'gro ba'i byed pa po nyid du ma grub pa sdod pa dang nyal ba la sogs pa'i byed pa po dang 'dug pa po dang nyal ba po la sogs pa 'gro ba po 'gro ba'i dpe nyid du mi @274a * //
translated: The nongoer is not established as an agent of another action, such as sitting, lying down, and so on.

original: 'dod pa'i phyir nged dbu ma pa'i dpe med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i phyir nged dbu ma pa'i dpe med pa ma yin no //
translated: The nongoer is not accepted as an example of the goer going.

original: des na sngar khyed kyis 'gro ba po 'gro bar ma grub pa dang 'gro ba po sdod par ma grub pa'i skyon ji skad bshad pa de ldog pa med de so na gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des na sngar khyed kyis 'gro ba po 'gro bar ma grub pa dang 'gro ba po sdod par ma grub pa'i skyon ji skad bshad pa de ldog pa med de so na gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the fault you previously stated, namely, that the goer does not go and the nongoer does not go, is not averted, but remains.

original: 'gro ba smra ba dag na re /🔽'on te brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na ni de lta na yang don 'gal ba nyid yin te smra ba po tshig smra bar byed cing /
analyzed: 'gro ba smra ba dag na re / 'on te brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na ni de lta na yang don 'gal ba nyid yin te smra ba po tshig smra bar byed cing /
translated: Those who assert going say:

original: gcod pa po shing gcod par byed pa dang de dang ldan pa nyid kyis de byed pa'i phyir zhes zer ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: gcod pa po shing gcod par byed pa dang de dang ldan pa nyid kyis de byed pa'i phyir zhes zer ba de'i lan du /
translated: If you assert the latter alternative, then the meaning is contradictory because the speaker speaks the words and the cutter cuts the tree.

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

analyzed: don 'gal ba nyid kyang ma yin te 'di ltar / 'gro ba gang gis 'gro por mngon // 'gro ba de ni de 'gro min //

original: 'gro ba gang gis 'gro ba po //
analyzed: 'gro ba gang gis 'gro ba po //

original: 'gro ba smra ba dag na re /
analyzed: 'gro ba smra ba dag na re /
translated: The proponents of going say,

original: 'on te brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na ni de ltar yang don 'gal ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'on te brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na ni de ltar yang don 'gal ba nyid yin te /

analyzed: des ni 'gro ba po'i chos 'gro ba gnyis dang mi ldan pa nyid bstan to zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma des ni rang las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba 'gro ba po 'gro bar byed pa ma yin pa'i sgrub pa'i chos 'gro ba gnyis
translated: The latter half of the verse indicates that the going that is different from the goer does not possess the two goings, which is the phenomenon that proves that the goer does not cause the going.

analyzed: dang mi ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba bstan to //

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba ni rang las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba 'gro ba po de 'gro bar byed pa ma yin par bsgrub pa'i skabs 'dir rjes su dpag pa gtan tshigs dang dpe dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba'i tshig tu 'gyur ba ni 'og nas
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba ni rang las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba 'gro ba po de 'gro bar byed pa ma yin par bsgrub pa'i skabs 'dir rjes su dpag pa gtan tshigs dang dpe dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba'i tshig tu 'gyur ba ni 'og nas
translated: The subject, the goer, does not cause going because of being a goer, like a goer who has gone and not gone.

original: chos can dang bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe nye bar sbyar ba rnams yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos can dang bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe nye bar sbyar ba rnams yin par sbyar ro //

analyzed: don dam par rang las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba ni 'gro ba po 'gro bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The subject, the going that is different from the goer, does not cause the goer to go because of being the going that is different from the goer, like the goer.

original: 'gro ba gnyis dang mi ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gro ba gnyis dang mi ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it does not possess two goings.🔽For example, it is like the one who is sitting.

original: dper na sdod pa po bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: dper na sdod pa po bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the property that proves, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na sdod pa po 'gro ba gnyis dang mi ldan pa'i phyir 'gro ba po 'gro bar byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /🔽rang las @282a * //
analyzed: dper na sdod pa po 'gro ba gnyis dang mi ldan pa'i phyir 'gro ba po 'gro bar byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du / rang las @282a * //
translated: For example, just as the one who is sitting does not possess two goings, therefore the goer does not make going.

analyzed: gzhan pa'i 'gro ba yang 'gro ba gnyis dang mi ldan pa'i phyir 'gro ba po 'gro bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, because the going that is different from the goer does not possess two goings, therefore the goer does not make going.

analyzed: gzhan dag na re / gang phyir 'gro po gcig pu la // 'gro ba gnyis su mi 'thad do //
translated: Others say:🔽Because it is untenable that a single goer🔽Has two goings.

analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gro ba po gcig pu la gang gis 'gro ba po zhes bya bar mngon pa dang 'gro ba por gyur nas /
translated: Because it is untenable that a single goer has two goings, therefore the goer does not make going.

original: gang 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i 'gro ba gnyis mi 'thad pa de'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba yang 'gro ba po 'gro bar byed pa ma yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma 'di la /
analyzed: gang 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i 'gro ba gnyis mi 'thad pa de'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i 'gro ba yang 'gro ba po 'gro bar byed pa ma yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma 'di la /
translated: Since it is untenable that going is twofold, that is, that which is gone over and that by which one goes, therefore going other than that also does not cause the goer to go.🔽This is the second half of the verse.

original: 'grel pa byed pa gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta ni 'di skad ces rnam par bshad par byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pa gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta ni 'di skad ces rnam par bshad par byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

original: kha cig na re /
analyzed: kha cig na re /
translated: Some say:🔽That is illogical.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis rang gi ming kha cig ces bya bar snyad btags nas gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de rigs pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis rang gi ming kha cig ces bya bar snyad btags nas gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de rigs pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is the statement of the commentator himself, who uses the term “some” to refer to the elder Buddhapalita and establishes that his explanation is illogical.

original: ci'i phyir de rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it illogical?

original: 'gro ba'i rgyu gcig kho na yod par khas blangs pas de dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gro ba po 'gro'o zhes bya bar bsgrub pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rgyu gcig kho na yod par khas blangs pas de dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gro ba po 'gro'o zhes bya bar bsgrub pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is asserted that there is only one cause of going, and because it possesses that, the goer goes.🔽

original: gang phyir 'gro po gcig pu la //🔽'gro ba gnyis su mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gang phyir 'gro po gcig pu la // 'gro ba gnyis su mi 'thad do //
translated: Because you accept that there is only one cause of going, and because he possesses that, the goer goes.

original: zhes smras pas don ci zhig go bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: zhes smras pas don ci zhig go bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the statement:🔽Because it is untenable that one goer🔽Has two goings?

original: 'gro ba po gcig pu la 'gro ba'i rgyu gnyis yod par mi 'thad do zhes bshad na 'gro ba'i rgyu gcig kho na yod par khas blangs pa yin pas 'gro ba'i rgyu gcig po dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gro ba po 'gro'o zhes bya bar bsgrub pa'i phyir de
analyzed: 'gro ba po gcig pu la 'gro ba'i rgyu gnyis yod par mi 'thad do zhes bshad na 'gro ba'i rgyu gcig kho na yod par khas blangs pa yin pas 'gro ba'i rgyu gcig po dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gro ba po 'gro'o zhes bya bar bsgrub pa'i phyir de
translated: If you explain that it is untenable that one goer has two causes of going, then you accept that there is only one cause of going. Therefore, because he possesses the one cause of going, the goer goes.

original: ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not logical.

original: gzhan yang gzhan pa nyid ma bkag pa'i phyir yang de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhan pa nyid ma bkag pa'i phyir yang de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not logical because otherness is not refuted.

analyzed: pha rol po dag 'dod pa'i 'gro ba po de las 'gro ba gzhan pa nyid ma bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the otherness of the goer from going is not refuted, it is not logical to say that the goer goes because he possesses the cause of going.🔽Moreover, it is not logical because the goer does not go.

original: gzhan yang / re zhig 'gro po 'gro'o zhes //
analyzed: gzhan yang / re zhig 'gro po 'gro'o zhes //
translated: Moreover,🔽How could it be tenable

original: ji ltar 'thad pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar 'thad pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: That the goer goes?

analyzed: zhes bya ba de dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zha'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is because it is no different from the earlier statement:

analyzed: gnas brtan buddha p'a li ta'i rnam par bshad pa de ni sngar // re zhig 'gro po 'gro'o zhes //
translated: The elder Buddhapālita’s commentary explains this as follows:🔽How could it be tenable

original: ji ltar 'thad pa nyid du 'gyur //🔽'gro ba med na 'gro ba po //
analyzed: ji ltar 'thad pa nyid du 'gyur // 'gro ba med na 'gro ba po //
translated: That the goer goes?🔽If there were no going,

original: nam yang 'thad @282b par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang 'thad @282b par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The goer would not be tenable.🔽This is because it is no different from the earlier statement:

analyzed: zhes bshad pa de dang khyad par med pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no zhes 'grel pa byed pa nyid zer ba yin no //
translated: This is what the commentator himself says.

original: gzegs zan pa dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzegs zan pa dag gis smras pa /
translated: The followers of Kāśmrī say:

original: 'gro ba gcig ni kho na ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba gcig ni kho na ste /
translated: There is only one going.

original: de ni 'gro ba po gzhan pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de ni 'gro ba po gzhan pa nyid yin la /
translated: It is the other one that goes.

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gro ba po la 'gro ba po zhes tha snyad gdags su rung ngo //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gro ba po la 'gro ba po zhes tha snyad gdags su rung ngo //
translated: Because it possesses that, it is tenable to call the goer a goer.

original: 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the cause of going,

original: de byed pa na 'gro'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de byed pa na 'gro'o zhes bya ste /
translated: when it performs that, it is called going.

original: dper na mar me snang ba'i rgyu yin pas snang bar byed do zhes bya ba bzhin pas /
analyzed: dper na mar me snang ba'i rgyu yin pas snang bar byed do zhes bya ba bzhin pas /
translated: For example, it is like saying that a lamp is illuminating because it is the cause of illumination.

original: gang phyir 'gro po gcig pu la //🔽'gro ba gnyis su mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gang phyir 'gro po gcig pu la // 'gro ba gnyis su mi 'thad do //
translated: For example, it is like saying that a lamp is the illuminator because it is the cause of illumination.🔽It is not logical to say,🔽“Because it is untenable that a single goer

original: zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: has two goings.”

original: bye brag pa dag na re /
analyzed: bye brag pa dag na re /
translated: The Vaiśeṣikas say,

analyzed: 'gro ba ni las kyi tshig gi don yin pas de ni gcig kho nar zad de las kyi tshig gi don 'gro ba zhes bya ba de ni rdzas kyi tshig gi don 'gro ba po zhes bya ba las gzhan pa nyid yin la//
translated: “Going is the meaning of the verbal root gam, which is a single action. The meaning of the verbal root gam, which is the action of going, is different from the meaning of the verbal root gam, which is the substance called a goer.

original: 'gro ba de dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gro ba po la 'gro ba po zhes tha snyad gdags su rung ngo //
analyzed: 'gro ba de dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gro ba po la 'gro ba po zhes tha snyad gdags su rung ngo //
translated: Because it possesses that going, it is suitable to designate the goer as the goer.

original: ci'i phyir 'gro ba de dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gro ba po la 'gro ba po zhes tha snyad gdags su rung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'gro ba de dang ldan pa'i phyir 'gro ba po la 'gro ba po zhes tha snyad gdags su rung zhe na /
translated: Why is it suitable to designate the goer as the goer because it possesses that going?

analyzed: 'gro ba'i rgyu ni 'gro ba po yin pa'i phyir 'gro ba de byed pas na 'gro ba po 'gro'o zhes bya ste ;
translated: Because the cause of going is the goer, the goer goes because it performs that going.

original: dper na snang ba'i rgyu mar me yin pa'i phyir mar mes snang ba de byed pa na mar mas snang bar byed do zhes bya ba bzhin pas de'i phyir dbu ma pa na re /🔽gang phyir 'gro po gcig pu la //
analyzed: dper na snang ba'i rgyu mar me yin pa'i phyir mar mes snang ba de byed pa na mar mas snang bar byed do zhes bya ba bzhin pas de'i phyir dbu ma pa na re / gang phyir 'gro po gcig pu la //
translated: For example, because the cause of illumination is a butterlamp, when a butterlamp illuminates, it is said that the butterlamp illuminates.🔽Therefore, the Madhyamikas say:🔽Because it is not tenable that one goer

original: 'gro ba gnyis su mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'gro ba gnyis su mi 'thad do //
translated: has two goings.

original: zhes zer ba de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ba yin no //🔽de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: zhes zer ba de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes zer ba yin no // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
translated: Therefore, that is not logical.🔽In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de ni bzang po ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis de ni bzang po ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: That is not good.

original: ci'i phyir bzang po ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bzang po ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not good?

original: gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa bsgrubs pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa bsgrubs pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because the reason stated is established.

original: ded dbu ma pas 'gro ba po 'gro ba'i bya ba dang ldan pa de 'gro bar mi byed de bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs ji skad smras pa de khyod 'gro ba smra ba dag gis bsgrubs pa'i phyir te /

translated: The reason you state is established by the proponents of going.

analyzed: khyed kyi gzhung las rang dbang ni byed pa po zhes 'byung ba'i gzhung por la /
translated: In your scriptures it says, “Independence is the agent.”

original: 'gro ba po ni 'gro ba'i rgyu @283a * //
analyzed: 'gro ba po ni 'gro ba'i rgyu @283a * //
translated: The goer is the cause of going,

original: yin te ; dper na mar me snang ba'i rgyu yin pa bzhin no zhes zer bas /
analyzed: yin te ; dper na mar me snang ba'i rgyu yin pa bzhin no zhes zer bas /
translated: just as a lamp is the cause of illumination.

analyzed: 'gro ba po ni kun rdzob tu 'gro ba'i rgyu khas blangs pa ni dngos kyi rgyu ma yin pas /
translated: The goer is asserted as the cause of going conventionally, but he is not the actual cause.

original: ded dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa khyed kyis bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ded dbu ma pa'i gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa khyed kyis bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore the reason stated by the Madhyamika is established by you.

original: gzhan yang ded dbu ma pas don dam par 'gro ba bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang ded dbu ma pas don dam par 'gro ba bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, the Madhyamika refutes going ultimately.

original: yang khyed zer ba de bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: yang khyed zer ba de bzang po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore your statement is not good.

original: don dam par 'gro ba ma skyes pas 'gro ba bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par 'gro ba ma skyes pas 'gro ba bkag pa'i phyir /

analyzed: 'gro ba med pa de dang 'gro ba po dang ldan pas 'gro ba po zhes tha snyad gdags su mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the one who goes is not endowed with going, it is not tenable to designate him as the one who goes.

original: gzhan yang med pa las skye ba bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang med pa las skye ba bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, because arising from nonexistence is refuted,

original: yang khyed zer ba de bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: yang khyed zer ba de bzang po ma yin te /
translated: your statement is not good.

original: khyed ni med pa las skye ba smra ba yin la /
analyzed: khyed ni med pa las skye ba smra ba yin la /
translated: You propound arising from nonexistence,

analyzed: khyed kyi gzhung de nged kyis don dam par bkag pa'i phyir yang 'gro ba po 'gro ba dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: but since we refute that ultimately in our scriptures, the one who goes is not endowed with going.🔽Again, the one who goes does not go, etc.

analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas 'gro ba po 'gro ba dang ldan pa ma yin par 'gog par byed do //
translated: refutes the one who goes is not endowed with going by way of inference.

original: de la 'dir yang 'gro ba po ni zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la /
analyzed: de la 'dir yang 'gro ba po ni zhes bya ba 'di ni chos can yin la /
translated: Here, the one who goes is the subject.

analyzed: 'gro ba dang ldan pa'i rgyu ma yin par shes te zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub par bya ba chos yin te /
translated: The predicate of the probandum is not a cause of going.

original: dper na ba lang gi lus rva dang ldan pa'i rgyu yin par shes pa de ltar 'gro ba po ni 'gro ba dang ldan pa'i rgyu ma yin par shes te zhes bsgrub par bya ba yin no //

translated: For example, it is known that the body of an ox is the cause of possessing horns. In the same way, it is known that the goer is not the cause of possessing going.

analyzed: blo dang sgra khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa'i chos yin te /
translated: The reason is stated: “because it is the cause of the application of the cognition and the term ‘goer.’”

translated: The goer is the cause of the application of the cognition of the goer and the cause of the application of the term “goer.”

translated: It is known that the goer is not the cause of possessing going.🔽For example, it is like an action. This is the example.

original: dper na las ni las kyi blo khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / las kyi sgra khyad par can 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /

translated: For example, an action is the cause of the application of the cognition of an action and the cause of the application of the term “action.”

analyzed: las dang ldan pa'i rgyu ma yin par shes pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as it is understood that the goer is not the cause of going because he is not the cause of the cognition of going,
